title: 114_hr3246
content: TEMPORARY AUTHORIZATION OF USE OF VETERANS CHOICE FUNDS FOR CERTAIN PROGRAMS. Temporary authority for other uses under subsection (c) of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 allows the Secretary to use up to $3,348,500,000 from the Veterans Choice Fund for non-department care during a specified period. The Secretary can use up to $500,000,000 for Hepatitis C treatment pharmaceutical expenses at non-Department facilities under the VA Budget and Choice Improvement Act until October 1, 2015. The Secretary must provide reports every 14 days to congressional committees detailing the amounts used for non-Department provider programs under the VA Budget and Choice Improvement Act. The term 'committees' refers to specific committees in the House of Representatives and the Senate. 'Non-Department facilities' and 'non-Department provider programs' are defined terms related to programs administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The Secretary contracts with health care providers at non-Department facilities to provide hospital care and medical services to veterans under various programs, including Section 1703 of title 38, the Veterans Choice Program, and the Patient Centered Community Care Program (PC3). The Secretary contracts with health care providers at non-Department facilities for various programs, including Section 1703, Veterans Choice Program, and PC3. The pilot program established by the Veterans' Mental Health and Other Care Improvements Act of 2008 (Project ARCH), contracts related to dialysis, and agreements with other departments are also included. The Secretary contracts with health care providers at non-Department facilities for various programs, including emergency care under sections 1725 and 1728 of title 38, United States Code. Subsection (d)(1) of such section is amended to include hospital care and medical services pursuant to subsection (c)(3) of this section. SEC. 2. EMERGENCY DESIGNATIONS. This title, except for section 7, is designated as an emergency requirement under the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. In the Senate, this title, except for section 7, is designated as an emergency requirement under the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2010.
